Additional FFMPEG arguments for the inpu: Additional FFMPEG arguments for the input stream (optional)
As frigate saves a large amount of data,: As frigate saves a large amount of data, it is recommended to use a separate directory or disk for it.
Camera input path must not be empty: Camera input path must not be empty
Camera name must not be empty and must n: Camera name must not be empty and must not contain spaces
Choose how to configure Frigate. The YAM: Choose how to configure Frigate. The YAML configuration file option allows you to provide a custom configuration file, while the UI option provides a user-friendly interface for configuring Frigate without needing to edit YAML files directly.
Don't send notification when zone list o: Don't send notification when zone list of the event is empty for this cameras
Enter the ioBroker IP Address in the fri: Enter the ioBroker IP Address in the frigate config under mqtt->host
Enter the ioBroker Ip Address in the fri: Enter the ioBroker Ip Address in the frigate config under mqtt->host
Frigate directory location must end with: Frigate directory location must end with a slash (/) and must not be empty
If enabled, the latest Docker image will: If enabled, the latest Docker image will be pulled when the adapter starts.
If no start snapshot send then send one: If no start snapshot send then send one update snapshot instead
MQTT Server Port in Frigate config: MQTT Server Port in Frigate config
Maximum number of objects to detect per: Maximum number of objects to detect per frame
Minimum Event Score 0.1-1.0 to notify. 0: Minimum Event Score 0.1-1.0 to notify. 0 = Disabled.
Minimum Event Score 0.1-1.0 to notify. 0 = Disabled. Camera specific: frigate.0.remote.notificationMinScore
Name: Name
Notification will only not send if all z: Notification will only not send if all zones of the event are excluded
Number of last Events History frigate.0.events.history
Send only Clip Url from event end: Send only Clip Url from event end
The amount of time (in seconds) to inclu: The amount of time (in seconds) to include in the recording after the event is triggered. This can help capture important context following the event.
The amount of time (in seconds) to include in the recording before the event is triggered. This can help capture important context leading up to the event.
The confidence threshold for object dete: The confidence threshold for object detection. Setting this can help reduce false positives by ignoring detections with low confidence scores.
The height (in pixels) to which the inpu: The height (in pixels) to which the input frames will be resized for object detection. Setting this can help improve performance by reducing the resolution of the input frames, but may also reduce detection accuracy if set too low.
The input path for the camera stream (e.g., RTSP URL)
The maximum length of recorded clips in: The maximum length of recorded clips in seconds. Setting this can help manage storage usage by limiting the duration of recorded events.
The maximum number of objects that will: The maximum number of objects that will be detected in each frame. Setting this can help manage performance by limiting the number of detections, but may also result in missed detections if set too low.
The minimum area (in pixels) of a detect: The minimum area (in pixels) of a detected object for face recognition to be applied. Setting this can help reduce false positives by ignoring small objects that are unlikely to be faces.
The minmal score to start the object det: The minmal score to start the object detection.
The non-maximum suppression (NMS) thresh: The non-maximum suppression (NMS) threshold for object detection. Setting this can help reduce false positives by suppressing overlapping detections of the same object.
The number of days to retain recorded cl: The number of days to retain recorded clips. Setting this can help manage storage usage by automatically deleting older recordings.
The port on which the container will be: The port on which the container will be reachable on localhost
The size of the face recognition model t: The size of the face recognition model to use. Small is faster but less accurate, while large is slower but more accurate. Medium is a balanced option that may work well for most users.
The target frames per second (FPS) for o: The target frames per second (FPS) for object detection. Setting this can help manage performance by controlling the frequency of detection, but may also result in missed detections if set too low.
The type of Google Coral accelerator to: The type of Google Coral accelerator to use. USB is the most common and compatible option, while PCIe may offer better performance but requires a compatible motherboard and additional setup.
The type of detectors to use. CPU is the: The type of detectors to use. CPU is the default and works without additional hardware, but may have higher CPU usage. Google Coral is an optional hardware accelerator that can significantly reduce CPU usage if supported.
The width (in pixels) to which the input: The width (in pixels) to which the input frames will be resized for object detection. Setting this can help improve performance by reducing the resolution of the input frames, but may also reduce detection accuracy if set too low.
Wait time after Events end for Clip crea: Wait time after Events end for Clip creation in seconds
docker_explanation: ioBroker will start and manage a self-hosted InfluxDB instance within a Docker container. This option is suitable for users who prefer to have InfluxDB running locally without relying on an external service.
